body:
From @citibeth 

Has anyone had problems with using "spack create" on a tarball distributed by FTP?  See below:

```
ankeli spack]$ spack create ftp://ftp.unidata.ucar.edu/pub/udunits/udunits-2.2.20.tar.gz
==> This looks like a URL for udunits version 2.2.20.
==> Creating template for package udunits
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/rpfische/spack/bin/spack", line 176, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/rpfische/spack/bin/spack", line 154, in main
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/home/rpfische/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/create.py", line 259, in create
    versions, urls = fetch_tarballs(url, name, args)
  File "/home/rpfische/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/create.py", line 218, in fetch_tarballs
    versions = spack.util.web.find_versions_of_archive(url)
  File "/home/rpfische/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/web.py", line 214, in find_versions_of_archive
    p, l = spider(lurl, depth=list_depth)
  File "/home/rpfische/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/web.py", line 176, in spider
    pages, links =  _spider((root_url, set(), root_url, None, 1, max_depth, False))
ValueError: need more than 0 values to unpack
```
title: spack create fails on FTP URL
